channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights appear to be stuck on red coming from horn lane, 15th February
item.description:
Traffic lights appear to be stuck on red coming from horn lane into peartree way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peartree Way, East Greenwich, Greater London

item.title: Rotating cone on the crossing not working, 15th February
item.description:
I am visually impaired and I found that the rotating cone on the pelican crossing at the junction of Valette Street and Morning lane is not working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Morning Lane, Hackney, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Too many potholes on Hind Crescent DA8 3BP, 15th February
item.description:
These potholes have been here since a few months and there are pebbles strewn around at many places on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hind Crescent, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: The bin have been emptied but they’ve left rubbish around every bin in London fields, 15th February
item.description:
The bins have been emptied but they’ve left rubbish around every bin in London fields and it’s absolutely disgusting. Please see photo of bins with new bags inside and rubbish covering the park.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): London Fields West Side, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress; cardboard boxes & plywood panel dumped, 15th February
item.description:
A Mattress; cardboard boxes & a plywood panel have been fly tipped next to the large blue recycling bins outside of 59 - 73 John Wilson Street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): John Wilson Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pothole around the drain cover., 15th February
item.description:
The pothole means that the cover moves leading to water splashing pedestrians walking on the pavement or waiting at traffic lights. The cause is likely to be bad drainage, as the pothole has become bigger in the past year, the drain cover is now moving, could result in car damage…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, West Gardens, Shadwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Blocked by water backup, 15th February
item.description:
This very narrow lane is blocked at the roundabout when it rains, even light rain, cars have to go over the other side of the road to avoid this very large and deep puddle. It is also access to college students who have to go across the road to access the college gates which is extremely dangerous and causes a health and safety risk to everyone
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winn Road, Horn Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped shopping trolley behind bushes and phone box on Rodway Road, opposite apollo Avenue, 15th February
item.description:
..trolley is behind the phone box and bushes on Rodway Road - phone box is opposite Apollo Avenue. If you moved the phone box, you wouldn’t have to continually deal with stuff being dumped here. It appears that flytipping here, is deemed acceptable. Pleaser remove asap Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horsley Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No asset number, next to park entrance, lamp on during daylight hours, 15th February
item.description:
No asset number (not even a degraded number), needs establishing. Lamp on during daylight. In closing the report please specify that both the lamp has been fixed AND the asset number has been applied to the pole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Betts Way, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing street tree, 15th February
item.description:
Please plant a replacement Flowering Cherry tree. The previous one was destroyed by a skip lorry during house renovation works. The stump has been ground down ready for planting but we're still waiting for our new tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Dunbar Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
